title: Showiest star of the summer garden

pars: One of the showiest stars of a summer garden has to be the Corymbia flowering gum. The masses of brightly coloured flowers produced at the ends of branches provide a spectacular display, and honey-eating birds and bees find the nectar-laden flowers irresistible.

When grown from seed, blossoms can vary in a range of colours from red, pink through to orange and white, and can have two-toned colours as well. The seed grown tree can also range in height from 2 metre mallee forms to 15 metre trees. Seedlings are not especially hardy on their own roots in many soil types. If you are after a specific colour or height, itâ€™s best to get one of the beautiful grafted forms available from your local nursery.

These cultivars are small to medium sized trees that may reach about 6-10 metres in height. They have large glossy dark green leaves with a light green reverse, along with decorative bronze new growth several times a year. Pruning is not necessary except to remove the lower branches so you can walk under them.
Corymbias prefer a full sun position in a well-drained soil. Mulch around the base in warm weather, and enjoy the colour!
